1. What will be the average DC output voltage if 300 V input AC voltage (line-to-line rms) is given to a 3-phase controlled full-bridge rectifier operating with firing angle of 30 degree?

explanations.b: Explanation 2: Substituting AC input voltage and the firing angle values in the following expression gives average DC output voltage.

questions.question: 2. Is it possible to get zero average output voltage while applying 200 V AC input voltage. If yes, under what condition it can be obtained?

answers.a: No, its not possible to get zero output voltage.
answers.b: Yes, by reversing the connections of the thyristors.
answers.c: Yes, by operating the rectifier at a firing angle of 90 degrees.
answers.d: Yes, by changing the phase sequence of source voltage

explanations.c: Explanation 3: Substituting firing angle of 90 degrees in the following expression gives average DC output voltage as zero.

questions.question: 3. What is the power factor for a three-phase controlled full bridge rectifier at a firing angle of 60 degrees?
4. What will be the effect on source current waveform, on using resistive load instead of highly inductive load.

answers.a: No effect on waveform shape but the rms source current value will change.
answers.b: Source current waveform will be pulsating AC.
answers.c: The rms value of source current becomes zero.
answers.d: Source current waveform will be shifted by 90 degrees.

explanations.b: Explanation 2: With resistive load the input current will be pulsating in nature.

questions.question: 5. How many thristors conduct under each mode of operation of a 3-phase controlled bridge rectifier?

answers.a: 2-thyristors, one from upper arm (T<sub>1</sub>, T<sub>3</sub>, T<sub>5</sub>) and one from the lower arm (T<sub>2</sub>, T<sub>4</sub>, T<sub>6</sub>).
answers.b: 3-thyristors, two from upper arm (T<sub>1</sub>, T<sub>3</sub>, T<sub>5</sub>) and one from lower arm (T<sub>2</sub>, T<sub>4</sub>, T<sub>6</sub>).
answers.c: 3-thyristors, one from upper arm (T<sub>1</sub>, T<sub>3</sub>, T<sub>5</sub>) and two from lower arm (T<sub>2</sub>, T<sub>4</sub>, T<sub>6</sub>).
answers.d: sometimes 2 and sometimes 3, depending on the mode of operation.

explanations.a: Explanation 1: At any given time one SCR conducts from the upper group and one conducts from the lower group.
